greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest integer m>0 such that the positive integers not exceeding m and coprime to n generate the multiplicative group U(Z/nZ).
comment: For all n>=3, a(n) is prime.
link: Burthe, R. J., Jr. Upper bounds for least witnesses and generating sets. Acta Arith. 80:4 (1997), 311-326.
Wikipedia, Multiplicative group of integers modulo n.
program: (PARI) { A285512(n) = my(S,s,t); S=Set([Mod(1,n)]); t=1; while( #S!=eulerphi(n), until(n%t,t=nextprime(t+1)); until(#S==s, s=#S; S=setunion(S,Set(S*t))); ); t; }
results.author: _Max Alekseyev_ and _Thomas Ordowski_, Apr 20 2017
